timeline.message:
Issue #4722 - remove websocket-servlet

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #4722 - remove websocket-servlet

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #4722 - fix typo in JavaxWebSocketConfiguration

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

those jars are provided as they come from jetty distribution if not they try to load slf4j impl

Signed-off-by: olivier lamy <oliver.lamy@gmail.com>

Issue #4722 - changes from review

- Fix packages exposed in the websocket configuration
- Make servlet dependency for websocket-util optional

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #4722 - fix build, websocket util exporting jetty servlet with jpms

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #4722 - create new module websocket-util-server

- This module contains the WebSocketUpgradeFilter.
- Also has an internal package with the components used
  to implement websocket upgrades common to both the
  jetty and javax websocket implementations.

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

Issue #4722 - fix typo for websocket-util-server jar

Signed-off-by: Lachlan Roberts <lachlan@webtide.com>

timeline.bodyText: @janbartel while debugging I saw this, any idea what this is for? I don't know what this is referring to, I don't think there is any jetty-websocket artifactId in jetty 10 so I thought this should be an errror.
timeline.author: lachlan-roberts
